generalInfo: This 13-day Tunisian journey offers a rich, immersive exploration that begins and concludes in Tunis. The itinerary immediately heads to the country's northwest, focusing on deep cultural immersion with a hands-on workshop dedicated to the UNESCO-listed Sejnane pottery tradition and exploration of the coastal town of Tabarka. Time is spent relaxing and hiking in the forested Ain Draham Highlands, punctuated by an authentic traditional lunch shared with a local family. The tour shifts to a profound historical track, taking guests through the Roman era with visits to the subterranean villas of Bulla Regia and the magnificent city of Dougga, North Africa’s best-preserved Roman site, complemented by an olive oil tasting and farm-to-table lunch. Returning to the capital region, the focus is on culture and gastronomy, featuring a guided exploration of the historic Tunis Medina, a hands-on Tunisian cooking class and market visit, and an afternoon among the ruins of Carthage and the picturesque blue-and-white village of Sidi Bou Said. The second half of the trip ventures south, connecting important coastal Medinas like Sousse with the colossal Roman Amphitheatre of El Jem. The landscape transitions dramatically in the Dahar mountains, where guests explore the ingenious troglodyte houses of Matmata and engage with the inspiring Women of GDA El Ferch cooperative. The ultimate adventure is a 4x4 expedition deep into the Sahara’s Grand Erg Oriental from Douz, culminating in an unforgettable night at a Berber desert camp after a traditional desert bread-making demonstration. The return journey includes traversing the striking Chott el Jerid salt lake, visiting the cinematic Star Wars filming locations and the natural wonders of the mountain oases (Chebika, Tamerza, Mides), before the final historical stops at the Roman ruins of Sbeitla and the holy city of Kairouan, before returning to Tunis for departure. If you'd prefer a shorter tour of Tunisia, you could also consider our 9-day Tunisian Encounters tour

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Tunis, transfer to hotel Upon arrival our staff will meet you at the airport and then transfer you to your hotel for the start of your trip. They will help you settle in, introduce you to the local area, and explain tomorrow's arrangements. The rest of the day is free to begin exploring the local area. OVERNIGHT

Sejnane pottery workshop, Tabarka, and Ain Draham Highlands Your day begins with a deeply enriching visit to Sejnane, a small town in Northwest Tunisia that is the proud home of a UNESCO-listed intangible cultural heritage

Guided Forest Hike and lunch with a local family Your day begins with a leisurely breakfast at the hotel in the refreshing mountain air of Ain Draham, preparing you for a day of nature and authentic local culture. Following breakfast, you will embark on a dedicated hiking tour in the forest of Ain Draham. This is more than a simple walk; you'll enjoy a guided hike led by a local expert who will reveal the region's rich ecological diversity. As you traverse the cool, shaded paths through the dense cork oak and evergreen trees of the Kroumirie Mountains, the guide will share insights into the unique flora and fauna of the area, highlighting the natural beauty and conservation of this distinctive Tunisian environment. The mid-day offers a truly special and memorable experience

Exploring historic Bulla Regia, the Medina of El Kef & bread making experience. Drive to Dougga Your day of historical exploration begins with a departure for the renowned archaeological site of Bulla Regia. Accompanied by your guide, you will delve into the region's rich past, discovering remarkable ancient ruins. Bulla Regia is particularly famous for its extraordinary subterranean villas, built below ground level to provide coolness during the hot summer months, offering a unique insight into Roman domestic architecture. Following your deep dive into antiquity, the journey continues to the historic city of El Kef, where you will visit the atmospheric old Medina. Wandering through its narrow streets provides a window into traditional Tunisian urban life. A highlight of the afternoon is a unique cultural and culinary experience at Dar el Khobz (the House of Bread). Here, you will not only sample but also experience the traditional craft of making and tasting different types of delicious regional breads, connecting you with an essential part of Tunisian daily life and hospitality. As the afternoon draws to a close, we drive toward the magnificent Roman city of Dougga. This journey positions you perfectly for the next day's explorations. Upon arrival, you will enjoy a relaxed dinner before your overnight stay in a local hotel near Dougga, ready to awaken to another day of discovery. OVERNIGHT

Visit the Roman Ruins at Dougga. Olive Oil Tasting and Farm to Table Lunch. Return to Tunis The day begins with a drive from Tunis to Dougga, a UNESCO World Heritage site and North Africa’s best-preserved Roman town. The morning is dedicated to exploring the extensive ruins, including the Capitol, the large Theatre, and the Lybico-Punic Mausoleum, offering direct insight into the site’s historical significance. Next, you will travel to the Domaine Ben Ismail Reserve or a similar estate for a practical, culinary interlude. This includes an organic olive oil tasting, where you will sample local varieties and learn about the pressing process. This is followed by a traditional, simple Tunisian lunch using farm-fresh ingredients. The afternoon concludes the trip with the return drive back to Tunis. OVERNIGHT

A DAY of Culture, Cuisine, and History. Medina, Cooking Class, Carthage, and Sidi Bou Said Begin your day with a fascinating, guided exploration of the historic Tunis Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage site and a dazzling labyrinth of covered souks, workshops, and centuries-old mosques. Your expert local guide will navigate the atmospheric alleyways, providing insight into the city's rich past as you discover hidden fountains, traditional artisan crafts, and the impressive architecture nestled within the ancient walls. The immersion in local culture continues with a hands-on Tunisian Cooking Class. This authentic culinary experience commences with a guided tour of the bustling Central Market within the Medina. Here, you will join your local chef to hand-select the freshest seasonal produce and ingredients. Following the market visit, you will be welcomed into a traditional Tunisian house where the chef will unveil their secrets during a comprehensive, practical demonstration. You will learn ancestral cooking techniques passed down through generations to prepare a true, delicious Tunisian dish, which you will then savour for lunch. In the afternoon, we delve into ancient history with a visit to the colossal archaeological sites of Carthage. We will explore the remnants of this legendary Punic and Roman city, including the expansive Antonine Baths of Carthage—the largest Roman public baths built in Africa—and the evocative ruins of the Old Punic Port. We conclude the day in the picturesque village of Sidi Bou Said. Enjoy a leisurely walk through its famed, charmingly paved streets, admiring the contrast of gleaming white walls and striking bright blue doors and window frames. This coastal jewel offers stunning panoramic views over the Gulf of Tunis before we return to your hotel. OVERNIGHT

Harissa making, Hammamet and Sousse Medina & the Amphitheatre of El Jem Begin your day with a satisfying breakfast at the hotel before heading north to the coastal town of Nabeul, famed as the craft capital of Tunisia. Upon arrival, you will immerse yourselves in the local culture by joining an interactive Harissa-making workshop. Under the guidance of a local expert, you will learn the secrets behind preparing the national condiment of Tunisia, from selecting and toasting the fiery chilli peppers to pounding the spices by hand, acquiring skills you can take back to your own kitchen. Following your workshop, we take a short drive to the nearby resort town of Hammamet, where you will visit the charming Old Medina. Here, wander along the ramparts and enjoy the views across the Gulf, exploring the compact, walled town centre known for its fragrant jasmine and picturesque fortifications. We then continue south to Sousse to explore its captivating, UNESCO World Heritage-listed Medina, a prime example of a fortified coastal town from the first centuries of Islam. After navigating the historic ramparts and narrow, bustling streets, you will visit the Archaeological Museum of Sousse, housed within the Casbah. This museum holds one of the finest collections of Roman mosaics in the world, offering a stunning visual record of ancient life and mythology. The historical journey culminates with a visit to the magnificent Amphitheatre of El Jem, another UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the best-preserved Roman colosseums in the world, rivalling even Rome’s in size. Explore this colossal structure and imagine the ancient spectacles that once took place here. Finally, we proceed to Sfax, where you will check into your accommodation for your overnight stay. OVERNIGHT

Journey to the Troglodytes and Desert Villages After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, we begin the day by heading south, venturing deep into the striking, semi-lunar landscape of the Dahar mountains towards Matmata. This Berber village is globally famous for its remarkable troglodyte houses—underground dwellings carved into the soft sandstone to escape the summer heat. You’ll have a chance to enter these fascinating traditional homes to appreciate the ingenious architecture and the way of life preserved beneath the earth. While in Matmata, we will specifically explore the Hotel Sidi Idriss, a classic example of troglodyte architecture and instantly recognisable as the interior set for the Lars Homestead (Luke Skywalker’s childhood home) in the Star Wars films. We will then pause for a panoramic photo stop at Toujane, a picturesque terraced Berber village nestled high on a ridge, offering breathtaking views across the vast landscape. The highlight of the afternoon is a meaningful visit to the Women of GDA El Ferch, a remarkable local cooperative. This organisation is entirely led by rural women dedicated to empowerment through sustainable agriculture and the preservation of traditional crafts. You will be welcomed into their authentic setting for a truly hands-on experience

Exploring the Sahara region, 4x4 experience and bread making. Overnight at a berber desert camp We start the day with a stunning drive along scenic mountain roads, traversing the dramatic Dahar region to reach Douirette. This peaceful, historic Berber village is known for its quiet charm and unique traditional architecture, which clings to the steep hillside. Our journey continues to the magnificent Berber village of Guermassa. Perched dramatically on a rugged hilltop, Guermassa is considered one of Southern Tunisia’s most picturesque settlements. You will have time to explore its ancient stone houses and enjoy breathtaking, panoramic views of the surrounding desert and mountain ranges. Next, we head toward the edge of the great Erg Oriental, arriving in Douz, famously known as the "Gateway to the Sahara." From Douz, the true desert adventure begins. We embark on an exhilarating 4x4 off-road journey deep into the sweeping dunes to reach Tembaine. Experience the thrill of travelling across the ever-changing desert landscape, plunging into the golden sands of the Grand Erg Oriental. As the sun begins to set over the vast dunes, we pause for an authentic Sahara Bread-Making Demonstration. You will witness the traditional preparation of Mellah, or desert bread, mixed and baked directly in the sand using age-old techniques passed down through generations—a truly iconic nomadic experience. Finally, we arrive at our Desert Camp. You will enjoy a delicious dinner under the stars before retiring to your tent, which combines comfort with an authentic desert experience, featuring a private bathroom for a restful overnight stay deep within the silence of the Sahara. OVERNIGHT

Journey from the Sahara to the Oasis City of Tozeur After a deep desert experience, we begin the day with an exhilarating 4x4 off-roading journey out of the dunes, following ancient tracks as we head back towards civilisation in Douz. Upon arriving in Douz, we will take time to explore its famous souk, a vibrant and authentic local market known especially for its traditional desert crafts, spices, and the characteristic red wool that Bedouins use for their blankets and clothes. This is a perfect opportunity to experience the atmosphere of a traditional Saharan town. Our journey then takes us across the striking salt lake of Chott el Jerid. We'll pause for memorable photos at this otherworldly location, where the vast, shimmering salt flats create stunning visual illusions and mirages, especially when the light is just right. From there, we drive to the oasis city of Tozeur. Upon arrival, we will check into our hotel and then proceed to visit the historic Medina of Tozeur. The architecture here is unique, featuring intricate patterns made from local, sun-dried bricks that distinguish it from other Medinas in Tunisia. You'll wander through its shaded alleyways and admire the distinctive craftsmanship. Finally, you will enjoy dinner before settling in for your overnight stay at the hotel in Tozeur, preparing for the next day's exploration of the region's vast palm groves and canyons. OVERNIGHT

Star Wars filming locations and desert oases Following breakfast, we embark on a journey into the cinematic sands of the desert, heading to Ong Jemel. This iconic site, whose name translates to "Camel's Neck," is instantly recognisable as a famous filming location from the Star Wars saga. We will explore this evocative site, offering stunning desert vistas and a fascinating connection to cinematic history, allowing for excellent photo opportunities in the vast, open landscape. The adventure then turns toward the Atlas foothills as we explore the region’s breathtaking mountain oases. Our first stop is Chebika, known for its lush palm groves and dramatic cliffs. Next, we visit the refreshing waterfalls of Tamerza, the largest mountain oasis in Tunisia, offering a spectacular contrast to the arid desert with its natural springs and cascading water. Finally, we delve into the awe-inspiring canyon and oasis of Mides. You will enjoy a guided walk through the breathtakingly narrow Mides canyon, providing stunning geological views. Afterwards, take a moment to appreciate the panoramic views of the picturesque oasis nestled deep within the gorge. In the late afternoon, we drive back to Tozeur, returning you to your accommodation. The afternoon is then yours to enjoy at leisure. You may choose to relax by the hotel pool, or explore the charming town at your own pace—perhaps revisiting the unique brickwork of the Medina or seeking out a local café. OVERNIGHT
